text.name: sys_description
text.text: The Tutor is a microcomputer developed by Matsushita on behalf of TOMY in 1982. Mainly intended for young Japanese audiences, it is a hybrid device which uses the technology of the TI-99/4A in many respects. While providing the power of a 16-bit TMS9998 processor, superior to that of competitors in the same price range. It embeds 16 KB of RAM, and can display a resolution of 256x192 pixels with the management of 32 sprites and a palette of 16 colors. But poor communication will make it a business failure.
